title: 113_s2076
content: The Act may be cited as the "U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors Enhancement Act". United States Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors. Section 51312 of title 46, United States Code, is amended to establish a Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy. The Board will provide independent advice and recommendations on Academy matters, with specific appointments outlined for Senators and House members. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy includes members appointed by various officials, such as the ranking member of the Committee on Armed Services, a Senator appointed by the Vice President, members appointed by the Speaker of the House, the Commander of the Military Sealift Command, the Assistant Commandant for Prevention Policy of the United States Coast Guard, individuals appointed by the President, and ex officio members from the Senate and House committees. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy includes members appointed by various officials, such as the chairman of the Committee on Armed Services, the Advisory Board to the Academy, and the member of the House of Representatives in whose district the Academy is located. Presidential appointees must include Academy graduates and a senior corporate officer from a US maritime shipping company involved in the Maritime Security Program. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy includes members appointed by various officials, such as the chairman of the Committee on Armed Services, the Advisory Board to the Academy, and the member of the House of Representatives in whose district the Academy is located. Members of the Board include a senior corporate officer from a US maritime shipping company involved in programs incentivizing vessel registration in the US, as well as Senate-confirmed Presidential appointees, Senior Executive Service members, or officers from the Coast Guard, NOAA, or military services commissioning Academy graduates. Each member serves a 2-year term. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors includes members appointed by various officials and consists of senior corporate officers, Presidential appointees, and officers from the Coast Guard, NOAA, or military services. Members serve a 2-year term, and vacancies are filled within 60 days of notification. Existing members continue to serve until a successor is designated. Substitutes may be designated if a member is unable to attend. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors includes appointed members such as senior corporate officers, Presidential appointees, and Coast Guard or military service officers. Members serve a 2-year term, with substitutes allowed if a member cannot attend. Substitutes must meet specific requirements and can participate in designated activities on a temporary basis. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors allows substitute members to fully participate in activities and report back to the Board. Every two years, a member of the House of Representatives or a Senator is selected as the Chairperson. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors rotates a member of the House of Representatives and a Senator as Chair on a biennial basis. The Chairperson cannot serve more than one consecutive term. Meetings are held several times a year, including at least one meeting at the Academy. Within 60 days of the Act's enactment, a meeting is organized to select a Chairperson and establish an official Charter for the Board. The Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy meets several times a year, including an annual visit to the Academy. They have access to all Academy facilities and personnel to fulfill their duties, which include assessing morale, discipline, curriculum, fiscal affairs, and other relevant matters. The Secretary of Transportation provides support to the Board. The Secretary of Transportation provides necessary support to the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors, including selecting a Designated Federal Officer. Staff members can serve without reimbursement, designated by the Chairperson of the Board, the chairman of the Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation, and the chairman of the House Committee on Armed Services. The Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy is allowed travel expenses while serving away from home. They must submit annual reports to the President and may also prepare reports on visits to the Academy. The Board can call in advisors for consultation. The Board of Visitors for the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy can call in advisors for consultation and preparation of reports to be submitted to the President, Secretary of Transportation, Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation, and House Committee on Armed Services. The U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors can consult advisors and prepare reports for submission to various government bodies. The bill was passed by the Senate on June 26, 2014.
